title: 113_hr5443
content: The Act is titled the "Putting America First Corporate Tax Act" and includes provisions regarding the inclusion of investments by controlled foreign corporations in subpart F income. The "Putting America First Corporate Tax Act" includes provisions amending Section 956 of the Internal Revenue Code to redefine the calculation of a shareholder's share of United States and foreign group property held by a controlled foreign corporation. The "Putting America First Corporate Tax Act" amends Section 956 of the Internal Revenue Code by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (e) and (f), and adding a new subsection (d) defining foreign group property as stock or obligation of a foreign person not a controlled foreign corporation. The "Putting America First Corporate Tax Act" amends Section 956 of the Internal Revenue Code by redefining foreign group property as stock or obligation of a foreign person not a controlled foreign corporation within an expanded affiliated group. The "Putting America First Corporate Tax Act" expands the definition of foreign group property under Section 956 of the Internal Revenue Code to include partnerships or other non-corporate entities that are controlled by members of an expanded affiliated group. The "Putting America First Corporate Tax Act" broadens the definition of foreign group property in Section 956 of the Internal Revenue Code to include partnerships or non-corporate entities controlled by members of an expanded affiliated group. This amendment also applies rules for pledges and guarantees by controlled foreign corporations. This change also applies to pledges and guarantees by controlled foreign corporations. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years of controlled foreign corporations and United States shareholders after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. TERMINATION OF DEFERRAL OF ACTIVE INCOME OF CONTROLLED FOREIGN CORPORATIONS. Amends Section 952 of the Internal Revenue Code to redefine 'subpart F income' for controlled foreign corporations. Effective for taxable years after December 31, 2014.
